dt: {bc}a long piece of heavy often squared timber suitable for use in construction
{bc}a wood or metal cylinder in a loom on which the warp {dx_def}see {dxt|warp:1||1a}{/dx_def} is wound
{bc}the part of a plow to which handles, standard, and {d_link|coulter|coulter} are attached
{bc}the bar of a balance from which scales hang
{bc}one of the principal horizontal supporting members (as of a building or ship)
{bc}the extreme width of a ship at the widest part
{bc}an oscillating lever on a central axis receiving motion at one end from an engine {d_link|connecting rod|connecting rod} and transmitting it at the other
{bc}a collection of nearly parallel rays (such as X-rays) or a stream of particles (such as electrons)
{bc}a constant directional radio signal transmitted for the guidance of pilots
{bc}the course indicated by a radio beam
{bc}the main stem of a deer's antler

et: Middle English {it}beem{/it}, from Old English {it}bēam{/it} tree, beam; akin to Old High German {it}boum{/it} tree
shortdef: a long piece of heavy often squared timber suitable for use in construction
a wood or metal cylinder in a loom on which the warp is wound
the part of a plow to which handles, standard, and coulter are attached

dt: {bc}to emit in {a_link|beams} or as a beam {dx_def}see {dxt|beam:1||2}{/dx_def}

dt.t: The sun {wi}beamed{/wi} its light through the window.
The house was {wi}beamed{/wi} with heavy timbers.
… the 90-minute show was {wi}beamed{/wi} to more than 200 countries and territories around the world.
{wi}beaming{/wi} images of the planet back to Earth
The amount of data {wi}beamed{/wi} over fiber-optic networks is rising exponentially every year, yet only 0.1% of fiber capacity is in use.

Infrared connectivity enables users to work collaboratively on documents without having to log on to the network, and for quickly "{wi}beaming{/wi}" data between different devices (for example, between two notebooks, or between a notebook and a printer, without a need for a cable).

et: Middle English {it}bemen{/it}, verbal derivative of {it}bem, beem{/it} {et_link|beam:1|beam:1}
shortdef: to emit in beams or as a beam
to transmit especially by satellite : broadcast

dt: {bc}inclined so much on one side that the beams approach a vertical position

shortdef: the ends of a ship's beams

dt: {bc}a sea whose surface motion is approximately at a right angle to the course of a vessel

shortdef: a sea whose surface motion is approximately at a right angle to the course of a vessel

dt: {bc}a mirror or prism or a combination of the two that is used to divide a beam of radiation into two or more parts

shortdef: a mirror or prism or a combination of the two that is used to divide a beam of radiation into two or more parts

dt: {bc}a weapon that uses a beam of energy or radiation (such as a laser beam) to inflict damage

dt.t: Despite this, inventors have envisioned giant superconducting storage rings that could provide huge amounts of power instantaneously for city power grids, or to power military {wi}beam weapons{/wi} for use against ballistic missiles.

shortdef: a weapon that uses a beam of energy or radiation (such as a laser beam) to inflict damage

dt: {bc}a narrow wooden beam supported in a horizontal position approximately four feet above the floor and used for balancing feats in gymnastics
{bc}an event in gymnastics competition in which the balance beam is used

shortdef: a narrow wooden beam supported in a horizontal position approximately four feet above the floor and used for balancing feats in gymnastics
an event in gymnastics competition in which the balance beam is used

dt: {bc}a vehicle headlight beam with a long-range focus

shortdef: a vehicle headlight beam with a long-range focus

dt: {bc}an iron or steel beam that is I-shaped in cross section

shortdef: an iron or steel beam that is I-shaped in cross section
